org.strongswan.android.utils

Class BufferedByteWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.strongswan.android.utils.BufferedByteWriter

  • public class BufferedByteWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    Very similar to ByteBuffer (although with a stripped interface) but it automatically resizes the underlying buffer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BufferedByteWriter()
      Create a writer with a default initial capacity
      BufferedByteWriter(int capacity)
      Create a writer with the given initial capacity (helps avoid expensive resizing if known).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BufferedByteWriter put(byte value)
      Write the given byte to the buffer
      BufferedByteWriter put(byte[] value)
      Write the given byte array to the buffer
      BufferedByteWriter put16(short value)
      Write the given short value (16-bit) in big-endian order to the buffer
      BufferedByteWriter put24(int value)
      Write 24-bit of the given value in big-endian order to the buffer
      BufferedByteWriter put32(int value)
      Write the given int value (32-bit) in big-endian order to the buffer
      BufferedByteWriter put64(long value)
      Write the given long value (64-bit) in big-endian order to the buffer
      BufferedByteWriter putLen16(byte[] value)
      Write the 16-bit length of the given data followed by the data itself
      BufferedByteWriter putLen8(byte[] value)
      Write the 8-bit length of the given data followed by the data itself
      byte[] toByteArray()
      Convert the internal buffer to a new byte array.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
